# Edge gRPC Mock Server

## Introduction

Simple mock of an [edge](https://github.com/0xPolygon/polygon-edge) gRPC server node meant to be used along a [zero-prover](https://github.com/mir-protocol/zero-provers) leader/worker setup.

It consists of two servers:

1. A gRPC server that mocks the functioning of an Edge node. It only implements a subset of all the methods such as `GetStatus`, `GetTrace` and `BlockByNumber`. Most of the data returned is randomly generated.

2. An HTTP server that either displays HTTP POST request data or saves it to the filesystem.

## Usage

1. Start the mock server.

```sh
$ go run main.go
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00 CEST 2023 INF http/http.go:32 HTTP server is starting on port 8080
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00 CEST 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:65 gRPC server is starting on port 8546
```

2. Send a POST request. The server will think you just sent a proof.

```sh
$ curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "username": "example_user",
  "email": "user@example.com"
}' http://127.0.0.1:8080/save
```

You should expect similar logs and the server to terminate.

```sh
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00 CEST 2023 INF http/http.go:46 POST request received on /save endpoint
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00 CEST 2023 INF http/http.go:64 Proof content: {
 "email": "user@example.com",
 "username": "example_user"
}
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00 CEST 2023 INF http/http.go:65 Terminating server...
```

3. Restart the server and send gRPC requests instead.

```sh
# https://github.com/fullstorydev/grpcurl
$ grpcurl -plaintext 127.0.0.1:8546 v1.System.GetStatus
{
  "current": {
    "number": "100000000000000000"
  }
}

$ grpcurl -d '{"number": 1}' -plaintext 127.0.0.1:8546 v1.System.GetTrace
{
  "trace": ""
}

$ grpcurl -d '{"number": 1}' -plaintext 127.0.0.1:8546 v1.System.BlockByNumber
{
  "data": ""
}
```

You should expect similar logs.

```sh
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00CEST 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:156 > gRPC /GetStatus request received
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00CEST 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:162 > StatusResponse: {{{} [] [] <nil>} 0 [] 0  number:100000000000000000 }
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00CEST 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:167 > gRPC /GetTrace request received
Fri Jul 28 12:18:00CEST 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:90 > TraceResponse trace: [123 34 97 99 99 111 117 110 116 84 114 105 101 34 58 123 34 48 120 49 102 51 57 101 53 100 54 99 56 100 51 100 50 54 56 98 52 ## Deploy it along a zero-prover
```

1. Start the mock server. Note that we provided mock data.

```sh
$ go run main.go
Mon Aug  7 10:21:00 UTC 2023 INF http/http.go:32 > HTTP server is starting on port 8080
Mon Aug  7 10:21:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:106 > Mock status data loaded
Mon Aug  7 10:21:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:123 > Mock blocks data loaded
Mon Aug  7 10:21:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:140 > Mock traces data loaded
Mon Aug  7 10:21:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:82 > gRPC server is starting on port 8546
```

2. Start a worker.

```sh
zero_prover_worker http://127.0.0.1:9001     --leader-notif-min-delay 1sec     -i 127.0.0.1     -p 9002     -a http://127.0.0.1:9002
```

3. Start the leader.

```sh
$ zero_prover_leader \
    --secret-key-path prover.key \
    --contract-address 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000 \
    --rpc-url http://change_me.com \
    --full-node-endpoint http://127.0.0.1:8546 \
    --proof-complete-endpoint http://127.0.0.1:8080/save \
    --commit-height-delta-before-generating-proofs 0 \
    -i 127.0.0.1 \
    -p 9001

Received payload for 206672!
Starting proof for height 206672...
BlockProofInitProofPayload { block_metadata: BlockMetadata { block_beneficiary: 0x91d85d44647a4b074be799a67a53471c4d5e303e, block_timestamp: 1690559940, block_number: 1, block_difficulty: 1, block_gaslimit: 30000000, block_chain_id: 2001, block_base_fee: 878822934 }, skip_previous_block_proof: true, num_txns_in_block: 0 }
```

Soon, you will see that the leader interacts with the mock server.

```
...
Mon Aug  7 10:22:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:148 > gRPC /GetStatus request received
Mon Aug  7 10:22:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:152 > Mock StatusResponse number: 206672
...
Mon Aug  7 10:22:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:207 > gRPC /GetTrace request received
Mon Aug  7 10:22:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:212 > Mock TraceResponse encoded data: [123 34 97 99 99 111 117 110 116 84 114 105 101 34 58 110 117 108 108 44 34 115 116 111 114 97 103 101 84 114 105 101 34 58 110 117 108 108 44 34 112 97 114 101 110 116 83 116 97 116 101 82 111 111 116 34 58 34 48 120 48 56 100 48 100 100 100 48 55 100 48 97 98 99 57 97 97 101 56 98 53 56 57 51 48 53 50 98 101 53 98 53 55 49 53 57 57 100 99 101 49 99 102 55 48 98 52 97 102 55 57 56 50 101 100 52 49 57 97 97 50 56 97 48 34 44 34 116 114 97 110 115 97 99 116 105 111 110 84 114 97 99 101 115 34 58 91 93 125]
Mon Aug  7 10:22:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:237 > TraceResponce decoded trace
{
  "accountTrie": null,
  "storageTrie": null,
  "parentStateRoot": "0x08d0ddd07d0abc9aae8b5893052be5b571599dce1cf70b4af7982ed419aa28a0",
  "transactionTraces": []
}
...
Mon Aug  7 10:22:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:170 > gRPC /BlockByNumber request received
Mon Aug  7 10:22:00 UTC 2023 INF grpc/grpc.go:176 > Mock BlockResponse encoded data: [249 2 211 249 2 206 160 249 194 9 216 192 190 43 207 165 141 200 215 120 190 45 105 16 88 122 69 38 143 63 193 131 21 160 13 206 131 108 37 160 29 204 77 232 222 199 93 122 171 133 181 103 182 204 212 26 211 18 69 27 148 138 116 19 240 161 66 253 64 212 147 71 148 145 216 93 68 100 122 75 7 75 231 153 166 122 83 Here's how it looks on the leader side.
```


Expect an error because the mock server will terminate after receiving the first proof.

